absolute.name: entity_model
absolute.description: This is a meta-model --- it is an entity model which describes the structure of a typical entity model --- as such this entity model is self-descriptive.

entity_type.name: xml
entity_type.description: Implementation details relevant only when instances of the subject the entity model are represented in xml.

attribute.name: namespace_uri
attribute.description: XML namespace used by elements when instances of the subject entity model are held in xml.

composition.name: attributeDefault
composition.description: The default representation of ER attributes within the XML schema to describe instances of the subject entity model.

entity_type.name: ENTITY_TYPE
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types absolute and entity_type_like.

entity_type.name: absolute
entity_type.description: An entity type which is defined to have a single instance which is the structural root of instances of this entity model.

entity_type.name: entity_type_like
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types entity_type and group.

entity_type.name: entity_type
entity_type.description: Instances of this type are entity types in the subject entity model. Each entity type describes a class of entities by describing the relationships that they participate in and the properties that may be attributed to them.

composition.name: xmlRepresentation
composition.description: Describes how entities of the entity type will be represented in xml.

entity_type.name: group
entity_type.description: A way of grouping entity types together. Groups may be used to assist in layout of an ER diagram or in some cases to partition an entity model into distinct modules used for example in code genweration into typescript.

attribute.name: annotation
attribute.description: Text to be placed on a diagram and used to trigger representation of the group outline on the ER diagram.

composition.description: The subtypes of a type or the contents of a group.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: An attribute of type string and that uniquely identifies a group or entity type. The name of absolute is the name of the whole and is therefore a name for the entire entity model.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Text documenting the meaning of the entity type or group.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: An attribute of type string. Where does this come from?

attribute.name: module_name
attribute.description: An optional attribute of a group. If this attribute has a value for a particular group then the group is interpreted as defining a module for code generation into typescript.

composition.description: This is only used for diagramming purposes. It is used to represent an exclusion arc on an ER diagram. In practice all outgoing dependencies from an entity type must be mutually inclusive and so every entity type with multiple outgoing dependencies implicitly has an exclusion arc.
The set of outgoing relationships from an entity type.
The set of attributes of an entity type.

entity_type.name: attribute
entity_type.description: A part of the structure of an entity type. An attribute is a named property that may be attributed to entitites of the type. Often thought of as a slot within an entity which may be filled in with a value. Dates, numeric values, names, text descriptions, colour and truth values (booleans) only make sense as the values of attributes of entities. Attributes may be core attributes or may be derived from other values. In a physical representation attributes may be present simply to implement relationships.

composition.description: If this is defined then the attribute is one that is only present in a physical entity model and is present to implement a particular relationship out from the entity type.

composition.name: type
composition.description: The type of the value of the attribute.
If this is defined then it signifies that the attribute is one of a set of identifying attributes of the entity type and therefore in a physical model a part of the primary key.
If defined then the attribute is optional.
If defined then the attribute is deprecated i.e. only used in historic data and is not to be used in future.

composition.name: xmlStyle
composition.description: How the attribute is to be represented in xml.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A textual description of the atttribute.

entity_type.name: Relationship
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types reference_or_dependency, constructed_relationship and composition..

entity_type.name: reference_or_dependency
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types dependency and reference..

entity_type.name: reference
entity_type.description: A binary relationship between entities but not a composition relationship.

attribute.name: js
attribute.description: A javascript expression to evaluate the reference relationship.

attribute.name: xpath_evaluate
attribute.description: An xpath expression which can be used to evaluate this reference using primary keys and foreign keys. This attribute is generated by logical2physical unless it is hand coded in the logical.

composition.name: key
composition.description: This relationship is defined for a relationships whose destination type is a pullback object and which is the unique relationship into the pullback determined by a 'diagonal' and a 'key'. Despite the fact that such relationships are represented as reference relationships even though might be better represented as certain types of constructed relationship.

entity_type.name: constructed_relationship
entity_type.description: A binary relationship between entities that can be derived from other more primitive relationships.

entity_type.name: composition
entity_type.description: A relationship between entities in which entitites on one side of the relationship may be said to be in part composed of entitites on the other side.

group.name: righthand_children
group.description: A generalisation of the types projection, identifying(1), inherited and cardinality..

entity_type.name: cardinality
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types ZeroOrOne, ExactlyOne, ZeroOneOrMore and OneOrMore..

group.name: composition_children
group.description: A generalisation of the types transient and initialiser..

entity_type.name: initialiser
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types pullback and copy..

entity_type.name: navigation
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types complex and component..

entity_type.name: complex
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types join and aggregate..

group.name: component children
group.description: A generalisation of the types identity and theabsolute..

reference.name: dest
reference.description: Introduced for potential use in better scoping of 'rel' relationship for which require 'previous' navigation. Currently derived during enrichment. .

group.name: attribute_children
group.description: A generalisation of the types implementationOf, value_type, identifying(2), optional and deprecated..

entity_type.name: value_type
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types boolean, date, dateTime, integer, float, nonNegativeInteger, positiveInteger, string and time..

entity_type.name: xmlStyle(2)
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types Attribute, Element(2) and Anonymous(2)..

entity_type.name: xmlStyle(1)
entity_type.description: A generalisation of the types Element(1) and Anonymous(1)..
